abstract: Suspicion that a lethal salmon virus escaped from ocean farms into the wild in British Columbia has renewed calls for moving such farms inland -- or shutting down such farms altogether.
snippet: Suspicion that a lethal salmon virus escaped from ocean farms into the wild in British Columbia has renewed calls for moving such farms inland -- or shutting down such farms altogether.
lead_paragraph: The detection of infectious salmon anemia, a lethal virus, in two juvenile wild sockeye salmon in British Columbia has reinvigorated a long-running debate about the sustainability of the aquaculture industry, particularly salmon farms.
